<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_ga1004_1_129"> </A> </FONT>
<BR><FONT SIZE=2><B>SDG MACERICH PROPERTIES,&nbsp;L.P.  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> Years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> (Dollars in thousands)  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>(a)</I></B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Partnership Organization</I></B></FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>On
December&nbsp;29, 1997, affiliates of Simon Property Group,&nbsp;Inc. (Simon) and The Macerich Company (Macerich) formed a limited partnership to acquire and operate a portfolio of
12&nbsp;regional shopping centers. SDG Macerich Properties,&nbsp;L.P. (the&nbsp;Partnership) acquired the properties on February&nbsp;27,&nbsp;1998. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>(b)</I></B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Properties</I></B></FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Affiliates
of Simon and Macerich each manage six of the shopping centers. The shopping centers and their locations are as&nbsp;follows: </FONT></P>
</UL>
</UL>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
shopping center leases generally provide for fixed annual minimum rent, overage rent based on sales, and reimbursement for certain operating expenses, including real estate taxes. For leases in
effect </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><I>The Macerich Company&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>129</FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>(c)</I></B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Revenues</I></B></FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>All
leases are classified as operating leases, and minimum rents are recognized monthly on a straight-line basis over the terms of the&nbsp;leases. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Most
retail tenants are also required to pay overage rents based on sales over a stated base amount during the lease year, generally ending on January&nbsp;31. Overage rents are recognized as
revenues based on reported and estimated sales for each tenant through December&nbsp;31. Differences between estimated and actual amounts are recognized in the subsequent&nbsp;year. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Tenant
recoveries for real estate taxes and common area maintenance are adjusted annually based on actual expenses, and the related revenues are recognized in the year in which the expenses are
incurred. Charges for other operating expenses are billed monthly with periodic adjustments based on estimated utility usage and/or a current price index, and the related revenues are recognized as
the amounts are billed and as adjustments become determinable. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>(d)</I></B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Cash Equivalents</I></B></FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>All
highly liquid debt instruments purchased with original maturities of three months or less are considered to be cash equivalents. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>130</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Macerich Company</I></FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=132,EFW="2175451",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=186025,FOLIO='130',FILE='DISK132:[07BHL4.07BHL1004]GA1004A.;28',USER='CMATTI',CD='26-FEB-2007;19:58' -->
<A NAME="page_ga1004_1_131"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>(e)</I></B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Properties</I></B></FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Properties
are recorded at cost and are depreciated using the straight-line method over the estimated useful lives of the assets as&nbsp;follows: </FONT></P>
</UL>
</UL>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="71%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="71%"><FONT SIZE=2>Buildings and improvements</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>35-39&nbsp;years</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="71%"><FONT SIZE=2>Equipment and furnishings</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>5-7&nbsp;years</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="71%"><FONT SIZE=2>Tenant improvements</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>Initial term of related lease</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Improvements
and replacements are capitalized when they extend the useful life, increase capacity, or improve the efficiency of the asset. All repairs and maintenance items are expensed as incurred.
Interest incurred or imputed on development, redevelopment and construction projects is capitalized until the projects are ready for their intended purpose. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Partnership assesses whether there has been an impairment in the value of a property by considering factors such as expected future operating income, trends and prospects, as well as the effects
of demand, competition and other economic factors. Such factors include the tenants' ability to perform their duties and pay rent under the terms of the leases. The Partnership would recognize an
impairment loss if the estimated future income stream of a property is not sufficient to recover its investment. Such a loss would be the difference between the carrying value and the fair value of a
property. Management believes no impairment in the net carrying values of its properties has&nbsp;occurred. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>(f)</I></B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Financing Costs</I></B></FONT></DD></DL>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Financing
costs related to the proceeds of mortgage notes issued are amortized to interest expense over the remaining life of the&nbsp;notes. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>(g)</I></B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Use of Estimates</I></B></FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
preparation of financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United&nbsp;States of America requires management to make estimates and assumptions that
affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosures of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses
during the reporting period. Actual results could differ from those estimates. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><I>The Macerich Company&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>131</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=133,EFW="2175451",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=825877,FOLIO='131',FILE='DISK132:[07BHL4.07BHL1004]GA1004A.;28',USER='CMATTI',CD='26-FEB-2007;19:58' -->
<A NAME="page_ga1004_1_132"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>(h)</I></B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Income Taxes</I></B></FONT></DD></DL>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>As
a partnership, the allocated share of income or loss for the year is includable in the income tax returns of the partners; accordingly, income taxes are not reflected in the accompanying financial
statements. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>(i)</I></B></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Derivative Financial Instruments</I></B></FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Partnership uses derivative financial instruments in the normal course of business to manage, or hedge, interest rate risk and records all derivatives on the balance sheet at fair value. The
Partnership requires that hedging derivative instruments are effective in reducing the risk exposure that they are designated to hedge. For derivative instruments associated with the hedge of an
anticipated transaction, hedge effectiveness criteria also require that it be probable that the underlying transaction occurs. Any instrument that meets these hedging criteria is formally designated
as a hedge at the inception of the derivative contract. When the terms of an underlying transaction are modified resulting in some ineffectiveness, the portion of the change in the derivative fair
value related to ineffectiveness from period to period will be included in net income. If any derivative instrument used for risk management does not meet the hedging criteria, then it is
marked-to-market each period and will be included in net income; however, the Partnership intends for all derivative transactions to meet all the hedge criteria and qualify
as&nbsp;hedges. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>On
an ongoing quarterly basis, the Partnership adjusts its balance sheet to reflect the current fair value of its derivatives. Changes in the fair value of derivatives are recorded each period in
income or comprehensive income, depending on whether the derivative is designated and effective as part of a hedged transaction, and on
the type of hedge transaction. To the extent that the change in value of a derivative does not perfectly offset the change in value of the instrument being hedged, the ineffective portion of the
hedge is immediately recognized in income. Over time, the unrealized gains and losses held in accumulated other comprehensive income will be reclassified to income. This reclassification occurs when
the hedged items are also recognized in income. The Partnership has a policy of only entering into contracts with major financial institutions based upon their credit ratings and other&nbsp;factors. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>To
determine the fair value of derivative instruments, the Partnership uses standard market conventions and techniques such as discounted cash flow analysis, option pricing models, and termination
cost at each balance sheet date. All methods of assessing fair value result in a general approximation of value, and such value may never actually be&nbsp;realized. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>132</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Macerich Company</I></FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>

<A NAME="page_ga1004_1_133"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
<BR>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>(3) Mortgage Notes Payable and Fair Value of Financial Instruments  </B></FONT></P>

collateralized by different shopping center properties. Mortgage notes payable at December&nbsp;31, 2006 consist of the&nbsp;following: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>At December&nbsp;31, 2005, mortgage notes payable consisted of $357,100 of debt that required monthly interest payments at fixed rates of interest ranging from 7.24% to 8.28%
(weighted average rate of 7.53%) and $267,900
of debt that required monthly interest payments at variable rates of interest (based on LIBOR) with rates ranging from 4.709% to 4.839% at December&nbsp;31, 2005. The balance at December&nbsp;31,
2005 also included $1,329 of unamortized debt premium that was recorded on debt assumed by the Partnership when the properties were initially acquired in 1998 and was being amortized to interest
expense using a level yield&nbsp;method. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><I>The Macerich Company&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>133</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=135,EFW="2175451",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=561009,FOLIO='133',FILE='DISK132:[07BHL4.07BHL1004]GA1004A.;28',USER='CMATTI',CD='26-FEB-2007;19:58' -->
<A NAME="page_ga1004_1_134"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
variable rate debt at December&nbsp;31, 2005 totaling $267,900 was covered by two separate interest rate cap agreements that effectively prevented the variable interest rate from exceeding
rates ranging from 10.63% to 11.83%. The Partnership's exposure to market risk due to changes in interest rates relates to long-term variable rate debt obligations. Through its risk
management strategy, the Partnership manages exposure to interest rate market risk by interest rate protection agreements to effectively cap a portion of variable rate debt. The Partnership's intent
is to minimize its exposure to potential significant increases in interest rates. The Partnership does not enter into interest rate protection agreements for speculative purposes. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
fair value of the fixed-rate debt of $795,424 and $357,100 at December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, respectively, based on an interest rates of 5.70% and 6.13%, respectively, is
estimated to be $801,352 and $359,144, respectively. The carrying value of the variable-rate debt of $267,900 at December&nbsp;31, 2005, and the Partnership's other financial
instruments at December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005 are estimated to approximate their fair&nbsp;values. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>(4)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Related Party Transactions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Management fees incurred in 2006, 2005, and 2004 totaled $2,063, $2,042, and $2,028, respectively, for the Simon-managed properties and $2,101, $2,302, and $2,012,
respectively, for the Macerich-managed properties, both based on a fee of 4% of gross receipts, as defined. In addition to the management fees, Macerich charged the Partnership an additional $627,
$521, and $620 for shared services fees in 2006, 2005, and 2004 respectively. In 2005, the Partnership paid a development fee of $336 to an affiliate of Simon in connection with a development project
at Valley&nbsp;Mall. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>Due
from affiliates and due to affiliates on the accompanying balance sheets represent amounts due to or from the Partnership to Simon or Macerich or an affiliate of Simon or Macerich in the normal
course of operations of the shopping center properties. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>(5)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contingent Liabilities  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The Partnership is not currently involved with any litigation other than routine and administrative proceedings arising in the ordinary course of business. On the basis of
consultation with counsel, management believes that these items will not have a material adverse impact on the Partnership's financial statements taken as a&nbsp;whole. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>(6)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subsequent Event  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In January 2007, the Partnership sold a portion of the shopping center at Eastland Mall that had previously been occupied by a major tenant to another major tenant. The sale of
the land and building resulted in a loss of approximately $4,800 which was recognized at the time of the sale in 2007. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>134</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Macerich Company</I></FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>

<TD COLSPAN=5><BR><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.1.9
<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>a2175451zex-10_19.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.1.9
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#07BHL1004_2">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="na1005_exhibit_10.1.9"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_na1005_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.1.9    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="na1005_tenth_amendment_to_amended_and__ten03966"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_na1005_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>TENTH<BR>  AMENDMENT<BR>  TO<BR>  AMENDED AND RESTATED<BR>  LIMITED PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT<BR>  OF<BR>  THE MACERICH PARTNERSHIP, L.P.    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="na1005_dated_as_of_october_26,_2006"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_na1005_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Dated as of October&nbsp;26, 2006    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS TENTH AMENDMENT (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Amendment</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") TO THE AMENDED AND RESTATED LIMITED PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT DATED AS OF MARCH
16, 1994, AMENDED AS OF AUGUST 14, 1995, FURTHER AMENDED AS OF JUNE 27, 1997, FURTHER AMENDED AS OF NOVEMBER 16, 1997, FURTHER AMENDED AS OF FEBRUARY 25, 1998, FURTHER AMENDED AS OF FEBRUARY 26, 1998,
FURTHER AMENDED AS OF JUNE 17, 1998, FURTHER AMENDED AS OF DECEMBER 23, 1998, FURTHER AMENDED AS OF NOVEMBER 9, 2000, AND FURTHER AMENDED AS OF JULY 26, 2002 (the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Agreement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") OF THE MACERICH PARTNERSHIP, L.P. (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Partnership</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), dated as of October&nbsp;26, 2006,
is hereby adopted by The Macerich Company, a Maryland corporation (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Company</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), as the general partner of The Macerich Partnership, L.P., a Delaware
limited partnership. For ease of reference, capitalized terms used herein and not otherwise defined have the meanings assigned to them in the Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
the General Partner desires to establish and set forth the terms of a new class of Partnership Interests designated as LTIP Units; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
the LTIP Units shall have the terms set forth in Exhibit&nbsp;B to this Amendment; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
Section&nbsp;3.3(a)(i)&nbsp;of the Agreement authorizes the General Partner to cause the Partnership to issue additional interests in the Partnership in one or more classes,
or one or more series of any of such classes, with such designations, preferences and relative, participating, optional or other special rights, powers and duties, including rights, powers and duties
senior to those of the Limited Partners, all as shall be determined by the General Partner in its sole and absolute discretion and without the approval of any of the Limited Partners; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
Section&nbsp;12.1(b)(iii)&nbsp;of the Agreement provides that the General Partner has the power, without the consent of the Limited Partners of the Partnership, to amend the
Agreement as may be required to facilitate or implement setting forth the designations, rights, powers, duties, and preferences of the holders of any additional interests in the Partnership issued
pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.3; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
the General Partner has made the determination pursuant to Section&nbsp;12.1(b)(iii)&nbsp;of the Agreement that consent of the Limited Partners of the Partnership is not
required with respect to the matters set forth in this Amendment. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW,
THEREFORE, the General Partner hereby amends the Agreement as follows: </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.2
of the Agreement is hereby supplemented by adding the following paragraphs (f), (g)&nbsp;and (h)&nbsp;to the end thereof: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Reserved.</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Reserved.</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Issuance of LTIP Units</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. From and after the date hereof the Partnership shall be authorized to issue LTIP Units. From time
to time the General Partner may issue LTIP Units to Persons providing services to or for the benefit of the Partnership. LTIP Units are intended to </FONT></P>

</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>

<A NAME="page_na1005_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>qualify
as profits interests in the Partnership. LTIP Units shall have the terms set forth in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;B</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> to the Tenth Amendment to this Agreement. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;New
Section&nbsp;4.1A of the Agreement is hereby added to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
purposes of the foregoing calculations of Section&nbsp;4.1, issued and outstanding LTIP Units with an associated LTIP Unit Distribution Participation Date that falls on or before
the Partnership Record Date for a particular distribution shall be treated as outstanding Common Units. LTIP Units for which the LTIP Unit Distribution Participation Date has not occurred as of the
Partnership Record Date for a particular distribution shall not be entitled to any of such distribution. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
making distributions pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.1 of the Agreement and allocations pursuant to Sections 2.1 and 2.2 of the Allocations Exhibit, the General Partner
of the Partnership shall take into account the provisions of Exhibit&nbsp;B to the Tenth Amendment to this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;5.5
of the Partnership Agreement is amended by designating the existing text of Section&nbsp;5.5 as Section&nbsp;5.5(a), and by appending the following
new Section&nbsp;5.5(b): </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To
the extent provided for in Regulations, revenue rulings, revenue procedures and/or other IRS guidance issued after the date hereof, the Partnership is hereby
authorized to, and at the direction of the General Partner shall, elect a safe harbor under which the fair market value of any Partnership Interests issued after the effective date of such Regulations
(or other guidance) will be treated as equal to the liquidation value of such Partnership Interests (i.e., a value equal to the total amount that would be distributed with respect to such interests if
the Partnership sold all of its assets for their fair market value immediately after the issuance of such Partnership Interests, satisfied its liabilities (excluding any non-recourse
liabilities to the extent the balance of such liabilities exceed the fair market value of the assets that secure them) and distributed the net proceeds to the Partners under the terms of this
Agreement). In the event that the Partnership makes a safe harbor election as described in the preceding sentence, each Partner hereby agrees to comply with all safe harbor requirements with respect
to transfers of such Partnership Interests while the safe harbor election remains effective. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Article&nbsp;IX
of the Agreement is hereby supplemented by adding the following paragraphs (f), (g), (h)&nbsp;and (i)&nbsp;at the end of Section&nbsp;9.1 thereof: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reserved. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reserved. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reserved. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Holders
of LTIP Units shall not be entitled to the Redemption Rights provided for in Section&nbsp;9.1 of this Agreement, unless and until such LTIP Units have been
converted into Common Units (or any other class or series of Partnership Units entitled to such Redemption Rights). Notwithstanding the foregoing, and except as otherwise permitted by the award, plan
or other agreement pursuant to which an LTIP Unit was issued, the Redemption Rights shall not be exercisable with respect to any Common Unit issued upon conversion of an LTIP Unit until two years
after the date on which the LTIP Unit was issued, provided however, that the foregoing restriction shall not apply if the right of Redemption is exercised by an LTIP Unit holder in connection with a
transaction that falls within the definition of a "change of control" under the agreement or agreements pursuant to which the LTIP Units were issued to such holder. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<UL>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
following definitions contained in the Glossary of Defined Terms of the Agreement are amended as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
definition of the term "Common Unit" contained in the Glossary of Defined Terms of the Agreement is hereby amended and restated in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"Common
Unit" shall mean Partnership Interests other than Preferred Units, Series&nbsp;A Preferred Units, Series&nbsp;B Preferred Units, Series&nbsp;D Preferred Units, Series&nbsp;N Preferred
Units, Series&nbsp;P Preferred Units and LTIP Units. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
definition of the term "Partnership Interest" contained in the Glossary of Defined Terms of the Agreement is hereby amended and restated in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"Partnership
Interest" shall mean an ownership interest of a Partner in the Partnership from time to time, including, as applicable, such Partner's Common Units, Preferred Units, Series&nbsp;A
Preferred Units, Series&nbsp;B Preferred Units, Series&nbsp;D Preferred Units, Series&nbsp;N Preferred Units, Series&nbsp;P Preferred Units, LTIP Units and Percentage Interest and such
Partner's Capital Account, and any and all other benefits to which the holder of such Partnership Interest may be entitled as provided in this Agreement, together with all obligations of such Person
to comply with the terms of this Agreement. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
definition of the term "Partnership Unit" contained in the Glossary of Defined Terms of the Agreement is hereby amended and restated in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"Partnership
Unit" shall mean a Common Unit, Preferred Unit, Series&nbsp;A Preferred Unit, Series&nbsp;B Preferred Unit, Series&nbsp;D Preferred Unit, Series&nbsp;N Preferred Unit,
Series&nbsp;P Preferred Unit or LTIP Unit and shall constitute a fractional, undivided share of the Partnership Interests corresponding to that particular class of Units. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
definition of the term "Percentage Interest" contained in the Glossary of Defined Terms of the Agreement is hereby amended and restated in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"Percentage
Interest" shall mean, with respect to any Partner, the percentage ownership interest of such Partner in the Partnership from time to time, represented by a fraction (expressed as a
percentage), the numerator of which is the number of Partnership Units then owned by such Partner, and the denominator of which is the total number of Partnership Units then owned by all of the
Partners. For purposes of calculations of Percentage Interests at any time, the Percentage Interest of any LTIP Unit Limited Partner and the total number of Partnership Units shall exclude any LTIP
Units for which the LTIP Unit Distribution Participation Date has not occurred as of such time. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Glossary of Defined Terms of the Agreement is amended by inserting the following definitions in alphabetical order: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>2006 LTIP Plan</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" has the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;3.B of Exhibit&nbsp;B to the Tenth Amendment to this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Book-Up Target</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" has the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;3.10 of the Allocations Exhibit. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Common Unit Economic Balance</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" has the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;3.10 of the Allocations Exhibit. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Constituent Person</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" has the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;7.G of Exhibit&nbsp;B to the Tenth Amendment to this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Economic Capital Account Balance</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" has the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;3.10 of the Allocations Exhibit. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
term "Profit or Losses" contained in the Allocations Exhibit is hereby amended to read "Net Income or Net Losses" in each place it is located. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.3(b)
of the Allocations Exhibit is hereby amended and restated in its entirety as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Immediately
prior to the times listed below, the Gross Asset Values of all Partnership assets shall be adjusted to equal their respective gross fair market values, as
determined by the General Partner using such reasonable method of valuation as it may adopt: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
acquisition of an additional interest in the Partnership by any new or existing Partner in exchange for more than a de minimis Capital Contribution; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
acquisition of a more than de minimis additional interest in the Partnership by any new or existing Partner as consideration for the provision of services to or for
the benefit of the Partnership in a partner capacity or in anticipation of becoming a partner; provided, however, at the time of grant of any LTIP Unit, the Gross Asset Values of all Partnership
assets shall be adjusted pursuant to this Section&nbsp;1.3(b); </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
distribution by the Partnership to a Partner of more than a de minimis amount of property as consideration for an interest in the Partnership; and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
liquidation of the Partnership within the meaning of Regulations Section&nbsp;1.704-1(b)(2)(ii)(g); </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided however </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>that adjustments pursuant to clauses (i), (ii)&nbsp;and (iii)&nbsp;above shall be made only if the General Partner determines that
such adjustments are necessary or appropriate to reflect the relative economic interests of the Partners in the Partnership. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.1A
is added to the Allocations Exhibit as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
purposes of determining allocations of Net Income pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.1, to the extent that the LTIP Unit Distribution Participation Date with respect to an LTIP Unit has
occurred, such LTIP Unit shall be treated as a Common Unit. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.2A
is added to the Allocations Exhibit as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
purposes of determining allocations of Net Loss pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.2, to the extent that the LTIP Unit Distribution Participation Date with respect to an LTIP Unit has
occurred, such LTIP Unit shall be treated as a Common Unit. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;3
of the Allocations Exhibit is hereby supplemented by appending the following new Section&nbsp;3.9: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.9&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Forfeiture Allocations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Upon a forfeiture of any unvested Partnership Interest by any Partner, gross items of income,
gain, loss or deduction shall be allocated to such Partner if and to the extent required by final Regulations promulgated after the effective date of the Tenth Amendment to this Agreement to ensure
that allocations made with respect to all unvested Partnership Interests are recognized under Code Section&nbsp;704(b). </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;3
of the Allocations Exhibit is hereby supplemented by adding the following new Sections 3.10 and 3.11 to the end thereof: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.10&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Special Allocations With Respect to LTIP Units.</I></FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=5,EFW="2175451",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="2",CHK=514225,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK133:[07BHL5.07BHL1005]NA1005A.;5',USER='KSOLTER',CD='27-FEB-2007;01:58' -->
<A NAME="page_na1005_1_6"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;After
giving effect to the special allocations set forth in Sections 3.1 through 3.9 hereof, and the allocations of Net Income (including, for the avoidance of doubt,
Liquidating Gains that are a component of Net Income) under Subsections 2.1(a) through (e)&nbsp;above, but before allocations of Net Income are made under Section&nbsp;2.1(f) above, any remaining
Liquidating Gains shall first be allocated to the holders of LTIP Units until the Economic Capital Account Balances of such holders, to the extent attributable to their ownership of LTIP Units, are
equal to (i)&nbsp;the Common Unit Economic Balance, multiplied by (ii)&nbsp;the number of their LTIP Units (with respect to each holder, the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Target
Balance</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"); </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>however</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that no such Liquidating Gains will be allocated
with respect to any particular LTIP Unit (each, an "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Ineligible Unit</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") if cumulative Liquidating Losses of the Partnership have exceeded cumulative
Liquidating Gains of the Partnership during the period from the issuance of such LTIP Unit through the date of such allocation. If, notwithstanding the foregoing, not all LTIP Units (including
Ineligible Units) are fully booked up, Liquidating Gains shall be allocated among LTIP Units in a manner reasonably determined by the General Partner. For the avoidance of doubt, Liquidating Gains
allocated with respect to an LTIP Unit pursuant to this Section&nbsp;3.10(a) shall reduce (but not below zero) the Book-Up Target for such LTIP Unit. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;After
giving effect to the special allocations set forth in Sections 3.1 through 3.9 hereof, and notwithstanding the provisions of Sections 2.1 and 2.2 above, if, due to
distributions with respect to Common Units in which the LTIP Units do not participate, forfeitures or otherwise, the Economic Capital Account Balance of any present or former holder of LTIP Units, to
the extent attributable to the holder's ownership of LTIP Units, exceeds the Target Balance, then Liquidating Losses shall be allocated to such holder to eliminate the disparity; provided, however,
that if Liquidating Losses are insufficient to completely eliminate all such disparities, such losses shall be allocated among LTIP Units in a manner reasonably determined by the General Partner. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Book-Up Target</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall be established for each LTIP Unit. The initial amount of the Book-Up
Target for such LTIP Unit shall be the Common Unit Economic Balance as determined on the later of (i)&nbsp;the date such LTIP Unit was granted or (ii)&nbsp;the LTIP Unit Distribution Participation
Date. The Book-Up Target shall be reduced (not to less than zero) by allocations of Liquidating Gains pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.10(a) and reallocations of Capital Account balances
pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.11, as determined by the General Partner. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Book-Up Target for any LTIP Unit for which the Economic Capital Account Balance
attributable to such LTIP Unit has at any time reached an amount equal to the Common Unit Economic Balance determined as of such time shall be equal to zero. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
parties agree that the intent of this Section&nbsp;3.10 is, (i)&nbsp;to the extent possible, to make the Capital Account balance associated with each LTIP Unit
economically equivalent to the Capital Account balance associated with the General Partner's Common Units (on a per-unit basis), and (ii)&nbsp;to allow conversion of an LTIP Unit
(assuming prior vesting) when sufficient Liquidating Gains have been allocated to such LTIP Unit pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.10(a) so that either its initial Book-Up Target has been
reduced to zero or the parity described in (i)&nbsp;above has been achieved. The General Partner shall be permitted to interpret this Section&nbsp;3.10 or to amend this Agreement to the extent
necessary and consistent with this intention. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
purposes of this Allocations Exhibit, the following definitions shall apply: </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Liquidating Gains</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any net gain realized in connection with the actual or hypothetical sale of all or substantially all of the
assets of the Partnership (including upon the occurrence of any event of liquidation of the Partnership), including but not limited to net gain realized in </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=6,EFW="2175451",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="2",CHK=120096,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK133:[07BHL5.07BHL1005]NA1005A.;5',USER='KSOLTER',CD='27-FEB-2007;01:58' -->
<A NAME="page_na1005_1_7"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>connection
with an adjustment to the Gross Asset Value of Partnership assets under the definition of Gross Asset Value in Section&nbsp;1.3 of the Allocations Exhibit. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Liquidating Losses</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any net loss realized in connection with the actual or hypothetical sale of all or substantially all of the
assets of the Partnership (including upon the occurrence of any event of liquidation of the Partnership), including but not limited to net loss realized in connection with an adjustment to the Gross
Asset Value of Partnership assets under the definition of Gross Asset Value in Section&nbsp;1.3 of the Allocations Exhibit. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Economic Capital Account Balance</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, with respect to a holder of LTIP Units, as of any date, its Capital Account balance, plus the
amount of its shares of any Minimum Gain Attributable to Partner Nonrecourse Debt or Partnership Minimum Gain, in either case as of such date and only to the extent attributable to its ownership of
LTIP Units. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Common Unit Economic Balance</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean as of any date, (i)&nbsp;the Capital Account balance of the General Partner, plus the amount
of the General Partner's share of any Minimum Gain Attributable to Partner Nonrecourse Debt or Partnership Minimum Gain, in either case to the extent attributable to the General Partner's ownership of
Common Units and computed on a hypothetical basis after taking into account all allocations through such date divided by (ii)&nbsp;the number of the General Partner's Common Units as of such date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.11&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Special Forfeiture Reallocations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. If, in connection with any forfeiture of LTIP Units, the balance of the
portion of the Capital Account of the holder that is attributable to all of his or her LTIP Units exceeds the Target Balance, such portion of such holder's Capital Account shall be reduced to the
Target Balance, and the Book-Up Target of all LTIP Units then held by such holder shall be reduced to zero. Otherwise, the Capital Account of the holder that is attributable to the
forfeited LTIP Units shall be reallocated in a manner reasonably determined by the General Partner. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;14.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exhibits
A, C and D, attached to this Amendment, are hereby made a part of the Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;15.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except
as expressly amended hereby, the Agreement shall remain in full force and effect. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the General Partner has executed this Amendment as of the date first written above. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="nc1005_as_of_october_26,_2006"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_nc1005_2"> </A>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
